snippet: The military-backed government is showing little patience with students protesting the Egyptian leadership and its efforts to control university campuses.
abstract: Egyptian security forces are tightening crackdown on student activism by arresting scores of students at start of the school term in effort to crush renewed wave of protests against military-backed government.

byline.contributor: Merna Thomas contributed reporting from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: The military-backed government is showing little patience with students protesting the Egyptian leadership and its efforts to control university campuses.

headline.main: Crackdown on Student Protesters in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Crackdown on Student Protesters in Egypt
